Matthew Kerr

Digital Product Designer

About Me

I'm a UX Designer at Trade Me, the biggest website in New Zealand.

I have a Masters of Entreprenurship from Otago, and a Bachelor of Design from Victoria focusing on Architecture, so naturally I've spent the last 7 years building products for mobile and web.

I'm pretty good at digital design and building products. I've spun up and killed more startups than I care to admit. And now I'm learning all I can in the corporate world.

If I had to describe my work – and I do since this is my portfolio – I'd say I'm honest, easy to work with, proactive, and focused on users. My communication and organisation skills are top notch, when they need to be, albeit a bit casual at times. I grew up in New Zealand after all. I am most comfortable as a contributor to a larger team with shared vision. I know when to put the extra efford in to get the outcomes we need.

Examples of my work are below, and thanks for taking the time to see my work so far.


Project
Payments
should be
invisible



Ping lets Trade Me members build up a stored balance when they sell things, which they can use it to pay for items on the site. Members can pay directly from their bank account, which is new in the NZ market.

Project
Measure and
manage risk
culture



Orange Umbrella run a programme for measuring and managing risk culture in the workplace. It uses a survey to measure leading risk indicators and then runs an in person, facilitated workshop to generate action plans to manage these risk causing behaviours and attitudes.

Read more

About Me

I have 7 years of experience in web and mobile technologies. I describe my work style as pragmatic, proactive, user focused, and thorough. My communication and organisational skills coupled with my experience with digital design and business skill make me a valuable contributor to a larger team. I value a positive environment, and collaboration.

I hold a Masters of Entrepreneurship from Otago University, and a Bachelor of Design from Victoria University.
